[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: active_validators()] [Memory Exhaustion] Does active_validators() clone the entire vector and map each ValidatorInfo, potentially causing memory exhaustion if active_validators contains thousands of entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: active_validators()] [Address Validation] Does active_validators() return addresses without validating they are non-zero or well-formed, potentially including invalid AccountAddresses in consensus? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: active_validators()] [Duplicate Addresses] Can active_validators() return duplicate AccountAddresses if active_validators contains the same validator multiple times, causing signature verification inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: pending_active_validators()] [Epoch Transition] Can attackers add malicious validators to pending_active that become active in the next epoch without proper validation of their voting power or consensus keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: pending_active_validators()] [State Inconsistency] Does pending_active_validators() accurately reflect validators that will join in the next epoch, or can the list be manipulated to include/exclude legitimate validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: pending_active_validators()] [Voting Power Manipulation] Can validators in pending_active have their voting power modified after being added to the list but before epoch transition, bypassing voting power increase limits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: pending_inactive_validators()] [Removal Attack] Can an attacker force legitimate validators into pending_inactive to reduce total voting power below safety threshold (< 2/3) before they're actually removed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: pending_inactive_validators()] [Liveness Attack] If all honest validators are moved to pending_inactive maliciously, can the network continue operating with only Byzantine validators in active_validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Function: pending_inactive_validators()] [Double Counting] Are validators in pending_inactive still counted in payload() and num_validators(), potentially allowing them to participate in consensus while being marked for removal? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: Serialize/Deserialize] [Deserialization Attack] Can a malicious on-chain update provide a serialized ValidatorSet with inconsistent total_voting_power/total_joining_power values that pass BCS deserialization but break consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: Serialize/Deserialize] [Type Confusion] Can BCS deserialization be exploited to create a ValidatorSet with mismatched vector lengths (e.g., active_validators.len() != expected count based on total_voting_power)? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: Serialize/Deserialize] [Malformed Data] Does deserialization validate that all Vec fields (active_validators, pending_inactive, pending_active) contain valid ValidatorInfo entries with proper BLS keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: Serialize/Deserialize] [Size Limits] Can an attacker provide a serialized ValidatorSet with millions of validators that passes deserialization but causes memory exhaustion during processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: Display fmt()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can the Display implementation's iteration over payload() cause excessive string allocation if there are thousands of validators, leading to memory exhaustion in logging? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: Display fmt()] [Information Leakage] Does the Display trait expose sensitive validator information that could be used for targeted attacks against specific validators? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: IntoIterator] [Missing Validators] Why does into_iter() only chain active_validators and pending_inactive, consuming the ValidatorSet while excluding pending_active validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: IntoIterator] [Type Safety] Can into_iter() be called multiple times on the same ValidatorSet (consuming it twice) through unsafe code, causing use-after-free vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: IntoIterator] [Iterator Ordering] Does into_iter() guarantee consistent ordering with payload(), or can different orderings cause ValidatorVerifier to map validators to wrong indices? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: OnChainConfig] [Module Identifier] Can MODULE_IDENTIFIER='stake' be exploited to read ValidatorSet from wrong Move module address, getting stale or malicious validator data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: OnChainConfig] [Type Identifier] Can TYPE_IDENTIFIER='ValidatorSet' collision with other types in the stake module cause type confusion when loading on-chain config? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Trait: OnChainConfig] [Access Control] Does OnChainConfig loading validate that the ValidatorSet resource is stored at the correct system address (0x1), preventing reads from attacker-controlled addresses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Integration: ValidatorVerifier::from()] [Index Mismatch] When ValidatorVerifier converts ValidatorSet, can inconsistent validator_index values in ValidatorInfo.config cause ValidatorVerifier to map validators to wrong positions in the bitvec? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Integration: ValidatorVerifier::from()] [Voting Power Mismatch] Does ValidatorVerifier correctly use individual validator voting powers from ValidatorInfo, or does it incorrectly use ValidatorSet.total_voting_power causing quorum miscalculation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Integration: ValidatorVerifier::from()] [Missing Validation] When ValidatorVerifier constructs from ValidatorSet via payload(), does it validate that validator_index values are sequential (0, 1, 2, ...) without gaps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/on_chain_config/validator_set.rs] [Integration: ValidatorVerifier::from()] [BTreeMap Ordering] Can the BTreeMap<u64, ValidatorConsensusInfo> ordering in ValidatorVerifier::from() cause validators to be reordered differently than expected by consensus? (High)
